article_title: Unemployment Is Dropping, Thanks To A Republican Policy That Obama Opposed

article_metadata.description: In January, in his annual State of the Union address, President Obama bragged that "our economy is growing and creating jobs at the fastest pace since 1999." It's great news, to be sure. But according to a new paper from the National Bureau of Economic Research, the recent improvement in the labor market may be due to a policy change that Obama adamantly opposed: ending extended unemployment benefits.
article_metadata.author: The Apothecary
